intro: Hieracium dshurdshurense, commonly known as the Dshurdshur hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant typically grows in alpine or subalpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and cooler climates. Its leaves are usually hairy and arranged in a rosette pattern, while its flowers are yellow and ray-like. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
